adjective.description: (in the Roman Catholic Church) relating to the Pope.
Characterized by a pompous and superior air of infallibility.
examples: such explanations were greeted with pontifical disdain

noun.description: (in the Roman Catholic Church) an office book of the Western Church containing rites to be performed by the Pope or bishops.

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin pontificalis, from pontifex (see pontifex).
